column4: i am trying to create an unbuntu cd so i can update my version, i have the iso downloaded but i can't get it to write to the cd in my try any suggestions
-- You're using Ubuntu?
yes
--- Right-click on the ISO -- It should prompt Burn using <> Creator.  Something like that.
yea i tried that, i im not sure if the disk drive is mounting
-- What do you mean?  When you burned the disc, and it's still in tray -- It'll show up on your Desktop.
that would be the problem i have no disk on my desktop showing that it mounted
-- Open the tray and close it again.  You might unmount it already.
trying that now
cd sounded like it was booting up then quit after about 10 secs
maybe my drive is just f-ed
-- Sorry to hear that -- What were you trying to do?  Update, you said?  You can just do it right there.
yea, but i have heard/read it was better to uninstall and reinstall
what's your opinion?
-- Uninstall and reinstall?  This is not Windows. >_>
well like install the newer version over the top of the old one

-- I suppose you can update but I think it's better that you reinstall it when the latest release came out -- I think you'll just get about same thing -- but you'll lose your setting unless you back up your data.
well how do i reinstall then?
-- You could add repos or try a new CD.  Did the dialog say the disc was burned 100%?
but i the dialog box appeared almost instantly after i told it to write the cd and it said it was a 100% done
-- See md5sum above.
-- Your download may be corrupted.
